name: lib/arc.js
Arc
description: Class representing an arc, or circular sectors

name: constructor
description: Creates an arc, or "circular sector" (a line string with n segments)

name: aspectRatio
description: ratio width/height of the image from which the arc is computed

name: geometry
description:
geometry of the Arc,
it is computed thanks to the {@link computeGeometry} method

name: fullGeometry
description:
geometry of the Arc: contains also end points,
it is computed thanks to the {@link computeGeometry} method

name: computeGeometry
description: Computes the geometry and assigns it to the geometry attribute of this class

name: intersects
description: Checks the intersection between the arc and a point

name: equals
description: Checks whether other is the same arc as this one

unknown.tagValue: {Boolean} whether it is the same or not

return.description: whether it is the same or not

Node

name: ASTree
description:
Data structure used for angular sectors,
based on the lines delimiting each angular sector
the delineation is done according to the line which separates
the angular sectors into two balanced groups

name: intersectionIndices
description: Intersection indices in the array of sectors

name: removeDuplicates
description: Removes the duplicates in an array

name: angleToVector
description: Converts an angle in degrees to a 2D vector

name: angleToPlane
description: Converts an angle to a 2D plane

params.name: isAlpha
params.description: starting or ending angle of the sector

name: complementaryPlane
description: Complementary plane : plane with normal with reversed direction

name: minimumIntersectingElements
description: Returns the connected component with minimum intersecting elements

name: differenceAboveBelowPlane
description: Number of sectors above/below the plane

name: connectedComponentToAngularSector
description: Converts a connected component to an angular sector

name: maxNumberIntersection
description: Function returning the maximum number of intersection for the given sectors

name: maxNumberSelfIntersections
description: Computes the max number of self intersections

name: traversedNodes
description: List of parent nodes until root

name: findPlaneInParents
description: Checks whether a plane is already existing in a parent

name: separateIntersectingSectors
description: Separate sectors which intersect (no proper delineating plane)

name: IsoVist
description:
Class allowing to compute the isovist in 2D, inspired by Suleiman et al's 'A New Algorithm for 3D Isovists"
the space is delimited by a set of segments and visibility can be determined by circular sectors associated with these segments

params.name: isDisplayPartial
params.description: if true display only partial visible segments, else display full visible segments

params.name: isDisplayPolygon
params.description: should display polygon or line segments

name: isDisplayPartial
description: if true display only partial visible segments, else display full visible segments

name: isDisplayPolygon
description: if true, displays polygon, else, union of line segments

name: isInsideArc
description: Checks whether a segment is contained inside an arc

name: segmentsFromPolygon
description: Extracts all segments constituting a polygon

description: From all the segments in the building, extract only those visible in field of view

description: Checks whether a segment is blocking, that is to say it is fully visible from the point of view

unknown.tagValue: {Boolean} whether segment is blocking with respect to segments

return.description: whether segment is blocking with respect to segments

description: Converts a point to the angle that it forms with the x-axis in degrees (theta in spherical coordinates)

name: visionBlockingArc
description: Computes the angle that is blocked by a segment

description: Merges consecutive arcs which have overlapping angles

name: freeAngles
description: Returns the complementary of blocked angles in the field of view

description: For partially visible segments, extract the part that is visible from the point of view

description: Computes partially visible segment(s) from a segment

unknown.tagValue: {Array.<ol.geom.LineString, Array.<ol.geom.LineString> >} if it is partially visible : first argument = full segment, second argument = array of visible segments ; else null

return.description: if it is partially visible : first argument = full segment, second argument = array of visible segments ; else null

name: freeSegments
description: Extracts all partially visible segments, that is to say to those who are in the free vision field

name: visibleBlockingSegments
description: Display visible parts of blocking segments

name: visibilityPolygon
description: Computes the isovist polygon from blocking segments

unknown.tagValue: {Array.<ol.geom.Polygon>} isovist as the segments from buildings visible from the point of view

return.description: isovist as the segments from buildings visible from the point of view

description:
Class allowing to compute the isovist in 3D, inspired by Suleiman et al's 'A New Algorithm for 3D Isovists"
the space is delimited by a set of polygons and visibility can be determined by spherical coordiantes associated with these segments
WORK IN PROGRESS

description: Checks whether a polygon is blocking, that is to say it is fully visible from the point of view

unknown.tagValue: {Boolean} whether polyAngle is blocking with respect to polyAngles

return.description: whether polyAngle is blocking with respect to polyAngles

content:
# Projet Optimum

Code for the client-side of the [Optimum Project](http://liris.univ-lyon2.fr/optimum/index.php/geolocalisation/)

## Getting Started

In order to be used properly, the Optimum server must be running (currently on Eidolon). See the [Optimum-server](https://github.com/fgrelard/Optimum-server) repository for more information.

Install the dependencies :
```
npm install
```

Compile the Javascript ES modules into a single bundle file, thanks to [`rollup`](https://github.com/rollup/rollup) :
```
npm run start
```

Then, open the `index.html` file in your browser.
name: ./README.md

content:
{
  "name": "optimum",
  "version": "0.0.1",
  "description": "Projet Optimum",
  "scripts": {
    "build": "rollup --no-treeshake --config rollup.config.js",
    "start": "rollup --config rollup.config.js --watch"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "rollup": "^0.41.6",
    "rollup-plugin-commonjs": "^7.0.0",
    "rollup-plugin-inject": "^2.2.0",
    "rollup-plugin-node-resolve": "^2.1.1",
    "rollup-plugin-uglify-es": "0.0.1",
    "rollup-watch": "^4.3.1"
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "bigdecimal": "^0.6.1",
    "esdoc": "^1.1.0",
    "esdoc-standard-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "inherits": "^2.0.3",
    "interactjs": "^1.3.4",
    "jquery": "^3.3.1",
    "jstree": "^3.3.5",
    "muuri": "^0.5.4",
    "npm": "^5.8.0",
    "ol": "^5.3.1",
    "ol-ext": "^3.1.0",
    "ol-layerswitcher": "^2.0.0",
    "papaparse": "^4.3.7",
    "rbush": "^2.0.2",
    "semver": "^5.6.0",
    "three": "^0.102.1",
    "transpose": "0.0.2",
    "util": "^0.10.3"
  }
}
